amphipolis.model

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • amphipolis.model.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Archaeologist, Assistant, Coder, Digger, Professor

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class representing a Character card owned by a player. Defines the common state (name, usage status) and the abstract interface for special abilities. Invariant: A character belongs to exactly one player. Invariant: A character can be in only one of two states: "Active" or "Used". Once used, it cannot return to active status in the same game.

    • Method Detail

      • getIsUsed

        public boolean getIsUsed()
        Checks if the character ability has already been used in this game.
        Returns:
        true if used, false otherwise.

      • setUsed

        public void setUsed()
        Marks the character card as used. Post-condition: isUsed becomes true.

      • useAbility

        public abstract void useAbility(Board board,
                                Player player)
        Abstract method that executes the character's special ability.
        Parameters:
        board - The game board (source of tiles).
        player - The player using the card (recipient of tiles).
